titleStmt.title: The case of the Company of Distillers of London, in reference to a bill, intituled, A bill for incouraging the distilling of brandy from corn, and for laying several duties upon low wines. Which bill will in reality prevent the distilling of brandy from corn, diminish the Kings revenue, and ruin the trade of distilling in England, and set up the same in foreign parts.
titleStmt.author: Company of Distillers of London.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Lincoln's Inn Library.
